td.content: s:patient c/o 2 days h/o severe shortness of breath (not checked), severe wheezing, severe chest tightness, Respiratory. NKDA. pt is a white male construction worker aged 24 Ys. consumes more than 4 alcoholic drinks daily Patient does not smoke o:Height 76 in, Weight 209 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 84, SystolicBP 114, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 18, Arterial Blood Gas 7.4,PaCO2=44 mmHg,PaO2=80 mmHg, Chest X-Ray normal appearing chest, O2 Sat: 90%, HEENT: WNL, Skin: mild perioral cyanosis, Pulm: mod bil wheezing with rales on LLL, wheeze-BIL, Mild distress in ""must sit up to breathe"", A&O x 3, Ext. No clubbing, cyanosis, edema, rales-LR, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest: RRR, audible wheezes w/o stethoscope a:Asthma p:administered Nebulized Ipratropium/Oxygen to 90% SaO2 - 500 mcg neb over 20 min, performed Arterial Blood Gas, Chest X-Ray, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

td.content: s:a 25 yo male presents w/ c/o 6 weeks h/o moderate breathlessness during exercise, moderate wheezing that worsens in cold air and mild sob. o:Height 75 in, Weight 203 lbs, Temperature 97.9 F, Pulse 76, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 15, nose = no nasal congestion, NAD, normocephalic/atraumatic (nc/at), Pulm: mild LLL wheeze o/w cta-b, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, HEENT: WNL, CTA-LL, wheeze-LU, PERRL, A&O x 3, wheeze-BIL, Chest: RRR, No M/G/R a:Asthma p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed Albuterol ("rescue inhaler") - 2.5 mg as needed for SOB, and ordered FEV1, FEV1/VFC, PEF, Pulse Oximetry.
